H0.text: Sperm is the source from which chloroplast genes are inherited in a few species.

H1.text: Mothers are the only source of chloroplast genes in a few species.

H2.text: Siblings are the only source from which chloroplast genes are inherited in a few species.

H3.text: Eggs are the only parent from which chloroplast genes are inherited in a few species.

A4.text: Gymnosperms, such as pine trees, mostly pass on chloroplasts paternally, while flowering plants often inherit chloroplasts maternally.

A5.text: There are many documented cases of angiosperms inheriting chloroplasts paternally.
